TopicTitle: Orbit keeps changing at the start of time warp

Articles.Content:
I'm going nuts. Unmodded install, never had mods. But when I warp along my orbit to fine-tune my orbit, I'm being thrown off sometimes dozens, sometimes hundreds of meters from my planned orbit. This is incredibly frustrating considering I am trying to deploy keostationary satellites in 120 deg phase, so precision is my objective. What could be causing this? I've already confirmed in the main menu that orbital drift compensation is still on. RCS is off.. 

Edited March 7, 2020 by Overheal

Some changing of the orbital parameters is normal, each time you change from time-warp to the full physics simulation,
because the 6 numbers that define your 3D position and 3D velocity are converted to the 5 orbital parameters and your position along that orbit. 
There is some round-off error each time you convert and convert back.  I've read here that Unity (KSP's underlying game engine) simulates physics with IEEE single-precision math, which carries just six decimal places (for the 3D position and 3D velocity).  That six-decimal-place precision can explain some of the effect you describe, but I have convinced myself that there are cases where KSP lets larger errors creep in.

Usually, though, the loss of precision doesn't stop us from setting up orbits as we want.   If you want to give a particular example, of what Pe and Ap and such you are trying to get and what the change is, maybe some of us here will recognize if you have found a case that behaves worst than usual, and maybe if we're really lucky have some helpful suggestions.

And welcome to the forum.
